alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 4:11AM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN OKALOOSA...SOUTHERN SANTA ROSA AND SOUTHEASTERN ESCAMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 415 AM CST... At 310 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ferry Pass to 4 miles southwest of Warrington. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Pace, Milton, Gulf Breeze, Goulding, Mary Esther, Bagdad, Myrtle Grove, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Pensacola Beach, Navarre Beach, Pea Ridge, and Floridatown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CST for northwestern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland
